author: Krishi Jagran
title: Weather Update: Heavy Rainfall Expected in Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh, Cold Wave Hits Northern India with Dense Fog
text:
The India Meteorological Department has forecast heavy rainfall across southern states, cold wave conditions in northern and central regions, and dense fog in the east. A well-marked low-pressure area over the Gulf of Mannar is expected to weaken, while a Western disturbance continues to influence the northern parts of the country.
Weather Systems in Play
-
Low Pressure Area Over Gulf of Mannar: The well-marked low-pressure system over the southwest Bay of Bengal near Sri Lanka has moved to the Gulf of Mannar. It is expected to weaken gradually over the next 12 hours as it moves west-northwestwards towards South Tamil Nadu.
-
Western Disturbance: A cyclonic circulation persists over north Pakistan with an associated trough at 5.8 km above sea level.
Rainfall Forecasts and Warnings
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicts significant rainfall activity across southern and coastal regions of India from December 12 to 18, 2024. Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Coastal [Andhra Pradesh](/news/walmart-to-support-6000-small-farmers-in-andhra-pradesh/), and other regions are likely to experience heavy to extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places during this period. Fishermen and residents in vulnerable areas are advised to exercise caution and follow local advisories. The following rainfall activities are predicted between December 13–18, 2024:
Region |
Date |
Rainfall Intensity |
Tamil Nadu & Karaikal |
17th Dec |
Extremely heavy rainfall in isolated areas |
13th, 16th, 18th Dec |
Heavy rainfall in isolated areas |
|

Lakshadweep |
13th Dec |
Heavy rainfall in isolated areas |
Andaman & Nicobar Islands |
13th–15th Dec |
Heavy rainfall in isolated areas |
Cold Wave and Temperature Forecast
India is bracing for a sharp drop in temperatures as cold wave conditions grip several northern, central, and eastern states. With minimum temperatures dipping to as low as 1°C in parts of Rajasthan, regions such as Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, and Madhya Pradesh are expected to experience severe cold waves over the coming days. Gradual temperature changes are also anticipated in East and West India, signaling the onset of harsher winter conditions.
Region |
Dates |
Warning |
Punjab, Uttar Pradesh |
13th–15th Dec |
Cold wave |
Haryana, Chandigarh, |
13th–15th Dec |
Cold wave in pockets |
Madhya Pradesh |
13th–16th Dec |
Cold wave |
Delhi, Bihar, Jharkhand |
13th–14th Dec |
Cold wave in pockets |
Dense Fog Warnings
Dense fog is expected during late-night and early-morning hours in Sub-Himalayan West Bengal, Sikkim, and Bihar until December 13, while the northeastern states are likely to experience similar conditions until December 17. Additionally, isolated ground frost is anticipated in Uttar Pradesh on December 13
Delhi/NCR Weather
Delhi/NCR is set to experience mostly clear skies over the next few days, accompanied by cold wave conditions in isolated areas. [Smog](/news/effective-solutions-to-combat-smog-earn-revenue-a-press-meet/) and mist are likely during the evening and night hours, with temperatures remaining below normal. The region will see northwest winds ranging from 6–14 kmph, contributing to the chilly weather. Residents are advised to prepare for cold mornings and reduced visibility during early hours.
Date |
Conditions |
Wind Speed |
13th Dec |
Clear skies, cold wave conditions |
<8 kmph (NW) morning |
14th Dec |
Clear skies, cold wave conditions |
10–12 kmph (NW) day |
15th Dec |
Clear skies, smog/mist in evening/night |
8–10 kmph (NW) day |
These weather patterns are expected to bring significant impacts, requiring residents in affected areas to remain alert and take necessary precautions.

author: Lil Zim
title: Don't Make These 3 Mistakes with Your Car This Winter in Illinois - NewsBreak
text:
By Lil Zim ,
2 hours ago The next time snow flies in Illinois, think twice before making any of these three common winter driving mistakes. For the last few weeks I have heard my kids say this at least once a day; "this winter is terrible" or "this is the real bummer winter", and I'd be lying if I said I don't slightly agree with them. Read full article
Read in NewsBreak

author: Kevin Rutherford
title: Tristan McKee Signs Spire Driver Development Deal, Will Run ARCA Races
text:
Tristan McKee has been signed to Spire Motorsports’ driver development program, Spire announced Jan. 16.
As part of the deal, McKee will compete in the ARCA Menards Series in 2025 in an as-yet-unknown number of races, alongside starts in various other series.
McKee became the youngest winner in CARS Tour history in 2022 when he won at Dillon Motor Speedway at 12 years old.
He’ll continue to run CARS events in 2025, as well as in the Trans Am CUBE3 Architecture TA2 Series full time.
See also Corey Day Comes Up Short of Lock-In Spot In Wednesday Chili Bowl Feature “We are really excited to have Tristan on board with us at Spire,” Spire co-owner Jeff Dickerson said in a team release. “We’ve taken a lot of pride through the years in identifying young talent and bringing them to NASCAR, however this wasn’t one of those cases. Josh Wise and Lorin Ranier called from General Motors, and based on my long history with both, it was one of those ‘if it’s good enough for them, it’s good enough for me’ kind of things.
“Frankly, everyone around Tristan has nothing but good things to say about his speed, work ethic and versatility. He obviously comes from a great family so we can’t take too much credit. Tristan will be making noise in this sport in the short and long term and we’re excited to be on this journey with him.”
“I think it’s pretty cool,” McKee added. “Nothing like this has happened to me before, so I’m really grateful for the opportunity that Jeff Dickerson and everyone at Spire Motorsports has given me. I think 2025 is going to be a really good year. We’re going to have plenty of races on the schedule, so I’m just looking forward to the opportunity and I can’t thank the people from Spire enough.”
The car for McKee’s ARCA starts has not been announced, though the team previously revealed its plans to field Corey Day in three series starts in 2025 in its No. 77.

author: EFE
title: En Ecuador disponen nueva orden de prisión preventiva contra exjefe de la Judicatura
text: En Ecuador disponen nueva orden de prisión preventiva contra exjefe de la Judicatura Wilman Terán fue detenido en el marco del denominado caso “Metástasis”, sobre una presunta trama de corrupción en los sistemas judicial, carcelario y policial por infiltración y sobornos del narcotráfico Un tribunal de Ecuador emitió este jueves una nueva orden de prisión preventiva por supuesta “obstrucción de la justicia” contra un exjefe del Consejo de la Judicatura, Wilman Terán, quien se encuentra en prisión por otro caso que indaga la presunta infiltración del narcotráfico en el sistema judicial. La Fiscalía General del Estado informó de que el juez Luis Rivera emitió órdenes de prisión preventiva, con fines de investigación, contra Terán y otros dos vocales del Consejo de la Judicatura, Javier M. y Maribel B., acusados por el Ministerio Público como “autores directos” del supuesto delito. También han sido procesados como “cómplices” otros funcionarios del Consejo de la Judicatura identificados como Andrés J., Marcela V., Carlos G. y Katherine L., agregó la fuente. Al concluir la audiencia, el juez Rivera acogió el pedido de la Fiscalía, dictó prisión preventiva contra Terán y Xavier M., mientras que a los otros cinco procesados les prohibió salir del país, presentarse periódicamente ante el tribunal y usar un grillete electrónico. El magistrado también ordenó la retención de los valores y cuentas bancarias de los imputados, y les prohibió enajenar los bienes que estuvieran a su nombre. Paralelamente, el juez Rivera emitió medidas de protección a favor del juez Walter Macías, el fiscal general subrogante, Wilson Toainga, y la agente fiscal Alexandra Zurita, por considerar que el Consejo de la Judicatura pudiera ejercer acciones de persecución e intimidación contra ellos por este caso. Toainga, en la audiencia, relató que esta investigación fiscal comenzó en 2022 ante un supuesto delito de tráfico de influencias que salpicaba a exvocales del Consejo de la Judicatura como Juan José M. y Maribel B. El caso recayó en el juez Macías, quien fue recusado por Maribel B., aunque la acción de la exvocal fue rechazada el 11 de mayo de 2023, horas antes de que la Judicatura suspendiera al juez Macías, en una sesión de esa entidad que, según la Fiscalía, estuvo marcada por irregularidades. Para el Ministerio Público, aunque las entidades del Estado tienen atribuciones propias, éstas no pueden ser usadas de forma ilegítima en función de impedir la acción de los jueces. La Fiscalía añadió que el delito de obstrucción de la justicia está tipificado y sancionado en un artículo del Código Orgánico Integral Penal. El pasado 19 de diciembre, Terán, que había sido detenido pocos días antes tras una investigación fiscal relacionado con la supuesta infiltración del crimen organizado en el sistema judicial, presentaba desde la cárcel su carta de dimisión como presidente del Consejo de la Judicatura. Ese mismo día, el Consejo de Administración Legislativa de la Asamblea Nacional (Parlamento) resolvía admitir a trámite una solicitud de juicio político contra Terán, así como contra los exvocales de la Judicatura Xavier Muñoz y Maribel Barrero, acusados por un presunto incumplimiento de funciones. Terán fue detenido en el marco del denominado caso “Metástasis”, sobre una presunta trama de corrupción en los sistemas judicial, carcelario y policial por infiltración y sobornos del narcotráfico.
